channel.title: Books on craneppeakare
channel.description: Recent content in Books on craneppeakare

item.title: [Review] Ultralearning by Scott H. Young
item.description: Finally my long awaited review of the book “Ultralearning” by Scott H. Young. I have been putting this off for far too long. This will not be a summary of the book as I have already done so in another post which you can find here. As someone who loves constantly learning new hobbies I thought this book would be right up my alley for leveling up my abilities. The book opens itself well by defining the demographic who would benefit the most from this book.

item.title: [Summary] Ultralearning by Scott H. Young
item.description: This is a no-bullshit summary of the book “Ultralearning” by Scott H. Young. Before getting to the 9 principles of what makes an effective Ultralearner, Schott H. Young prefaces by explaining the manic-level obbession that many ultralearners exhibit to their chosen skill. They obsess over every tiny efficiency and detail, and while this degree of obsession may be difficult to achieve for a skill meant just as a simple hobby or to promote skills beneficial to your work force, learning their principles can help you become a more effective learning for anything you may wish to pursue in your life.
